topics.body:
I have a random ass question out of nowhere:
I'm finally getting the fuck out of being depressed and wanting to go back to drawing art and have been thinking about potentially making a comic.

The question is my idea for it any good?  The premise is it's set in 2050 about a android. . No it's not megaman.  What I mean is that the idea I have is that the two main charcters is she and her boyfriend go around debating against anti-science individuals who claim that prosthetics, robotics, gene therapy and so forth are against nature taking a page from current anti-science groups.  It's probably going to piss off a lot of people in that all the people who believe in faith healing and alternative medicine.
I've already thought about the ending and everything and don't want it to drag on too long.  So spoiler pants mcgee [spoiler]The ending is that a artificial uterus is developed and they do the dirty and she gets implanted with a donated egg thus ending on the note of a news firestorm about, "Morality in these kids today is going downhill" and them trying to pass through congress a bill to ban it which I will jokingly call the, "Science stop developing in ways I don't like" bill[/spoiler]
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52f337ab63687226cf4c0100#post_52f337ab63687226cf4c0100

It's good to try and carry a message but if it's carried to bluntly or even too one-sided then it risks loosing it's charm. It basically becomes the equivalent of being hit in the head with a ton of bricks. The themes have to be sprinkled in and presented in some state of being abstract or between abstract and nonabstract.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52f33635636872272c8f0000#post_52f33635636872272c8f0000
I'd read the fuck out of that.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@AaronMk":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52f33913636872287d4c0200#post_52f33913636872287d4c0200
Would a good way of doing that would be to have the main person opposing them actually be intelligent and not hit them with the stupid stick, but instead have them as a fairly intelligent individual who is a good debater?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52f33a58636872268eb70200#post_52f33a58636872268eb70200
Yes.
Have them be erudite and have genuine moral concerns
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52f33a58636872268eb70200#post_52f33a58636872268eb70200

Another way to take it a "show, don't tell" sort of focus. We don't see MLP constantly spending 25 minutes recalling a lengthy essay on how it's good to be modest to one's friends. It's played out in a scenario. You may then need to play through scenarios that could really just build up anyone in the comic.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
The first death in my Dwarf Fortress game (remember that?) was Whatevs, who died of thirst because for some ungodly he was trying to drink water like some kind of filthy elf rather than booze like a proper dwarf.

Granted, I probably shouldn't have embarked in a scorching hot area where all the water dries up in the summer.

The irony is that the message popped up minutes after I'd bought a shitload of booze off some elf traders.

EDIT: And AaronMK has also died of thirst. Goddamn it, he was my expedition leader!

EDIT the second: Well this is fucked. I got dwarves dropping like flies all up in this bitch! Ah well. That's Dwarf Fortress. I just wish it was from something cool instead of dehydration.

EDIT the third: Gonna go ahead and abandon this fortress and start again in some place where the water doesn't vanish for half the year.
